title: Head of Japan Marketing
content:
Who we are
About Stripe
Stripe is a financial infrastructure platform for businesses. Millions of companies—from the world’s largest enterprises to the most ambitious startups—use Stripe to accept payments, grow their revenue, and accelerate new business opportunities. Our mission is to increase the GDP of the internet, and we have a staggering amount of work ahead. That means you have an unprecedented opportunity to put the global economy within everyone’s reach while doing the most important work of your career.
About the team
Our Japan Marketing team’s mission is to engage priority audiences through impactful and relevant marketing campaigns and events, to drive growth in adoption of Stripe’s solution offerings. Japan Marketing is a sales-aligned team, partnering closely with the Japan GTM organization, including Sales, Sales Development, Solutions Architects, Partnerships, and others. Our team works across all customer segments, and at each stage of the customer lifecycle journey. As a member of the Japan team, this is a great opportunity to build and have an impact on the Japan business.
What you’ll do
You’ll be part of the Japan team and be able to set our Japanese marketing strategy, as well as be hands-on, and develop a strong trusted relationship working hand-in-hand with sales teams to drive successful user outcomes. The Head of Japan Marketing will lead the field marketing function and will set and execute a marketing strategy that delivers high-quality leads, sales pipeline, and ultimately revenue.  You will build, lead, and grow a small team of marketing leaders and professionals and as an early member of the team, you will have an opportunity to build the Japan marketing function at Stripe.
Responsibilities

Lead marketing for Japan across all customer segments, with strong coordination with Sales leadership; customer segments include enterprise, digital native, software platforms, small businesses, and startups 
Own key business and revenue metrics across the sales funnel (pipeline) and customer growth and retention. 
Develop a strong trusted relationship with the Japanese sales team, working closely with the sales leadership and sales development to jointly grow pipeline.
Partner with Asia Pacific demand generation and product marketing to refine our targeting and segmentation, and to identify, scope, and produce or localize compelling content, marketing assets and programs to drive demand
Define and execute full funnel Japan marketing plans including digital marketing, demand generation campaigns, sales prospecting programs and ABM, virtual and in-person field events, and third party tradeshows and conferences
Track, measure, and communicate program results, continually optimize for efficiency and scale, and seek to generate new global best practices through experimental efforts  
Be creative in finding new ways of advising a diverse range of personas about the value Stripe brings to businesses 

Who you are
We’re looking for someone who meets the minimum requirements to be considered for the role. If you meet these requirements, you are encouraged to apply. The preferred qualifications are a bonus, not a requirement.
Minimum requirements

8+ years of relevant B2B marketing experience leading a Japan marketing function across multiple customer segments including specific experience with content localisation and content marketing, event management, partnership marketing, and multi-touch campaigns to generate demand
5+ years of team management experience
Proven track record of defining and executing Japan B2B marketing strategies that deliver against funnel metrics and KPIs
Strong written and verbal communication skills (both Japanese and English), including being able to convey complex topics with simplicity
Proven leadership capability and effectiveness working collaboratively and cross functionally:

Experience working closely with Sales teams, including joint planning and execution, driving disciplined lead follow up, and earning trust as a strategic business partner
Experience working as a Japanese leader partnering with global marketing teams, and leveraging central APAC capabilities and resources to lead growth in field marketing programs and events, executive programs and partner programs.


Experience scaling through/and or leveraging agency and contractor resources
Understanding and/or experience with CRM, account-based marketing and email marketing tactics and technology

Preferred qualifications

A startup mentality with a bias to action and the ability to flex in a fast-paced industry and work environment
Experience marketing cloud services and/or software solutions 
Superb organization and project management skills and the capacity to manage multiple complex projects at once
Excellent analytical skills and the ability to craft actionable insights from complex data
Resourceful, creative and dedicated to achieving operational and creative excellence
Experience delivering tailored marketing content and experiences for customer segments spanning from early stage startups to the largest enterprise companies
Understanding of the payments, financial technology, and/or ecommerce industries and partner ecosystems
Demonstrated success delivering marketing programs with and through consulting and technology partners

questions.description: Stripe is currently operating in a hybrid work environment. In-office expectations for office-assigned Stripes vary by team. A remote location, in most cases, is defined as living 50 miles or more from an office location. While you would be welcome to join the office for team or business meetings when necessary, the expectation would be that you would regularly work from home rather than a Stripe office location. Stripe offices are located in Amsterdam, Bangkok, Bengaluru, Berlin, Chicago, Dubai, Dublin, Jakarta, London, Madrid, Mexico City, New York City, Paris, São Paulo, Singapore, South San Francisco, Seattle, Tokyo, and Toronto. Stripe does not cover the cost of relocating to a remote location. We encourage you to apply for roles that match the location in which you live or have intentions to live.
